w:r.w:t: We use apostrophes for two reasons: to make contractions and to show possession.

We also use apostrophes to indicate possession.
For many nouns, we denote possession by sticking an apostrophe at the end of the word and gluing on an
We can also do this for an abstract concept like time, even though time doesn't physically possess like a person does.

However, there are some nouns where we do something else to another part of the word to make it plural. Here, wom
n. Even though women is plural, it doesn't have an
There are three similar words that also show up on the test: men, children, and people.
